items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

We're looking for strong technologists who are good at talking directly to customers.

Company:

Platform.sh the award-winning PaaS solution is looking for a talented customer support engineer who is passionate about site uptime and happy customers.

Our customers run thousands of web applications in over 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on multiple public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem. We can clone whole running systems, including the data, services, and networking in a matter seconds. The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers. 

Our customers need top-notch support to master the Platform.sh fun. Can you explain the intricacies of command line tools? We run OEM PaaS services for famous brands like Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and Sensio Cloud - can you help us build and run these vibrant software products?

Responsibilities:

As a Customer Support Engineer, based in Europe, you liaise with customers with concerns and feed the engineering team with feedbacks. You will also be essential for diagnostics and debugging of failing applications and systems, and you have a strong mandate to help us automate and streamline everything we do. You are periodically on call in case disaster strikes. You're our front line, and when our customers think of how great Platform.sh is, they think of you.

  • diagnose and debug failing applications and systems
  • respond to customer inquiries concerns and suggestions about our product in a timely manner
  • deploy and configure cloud resources
  • participate in on-call response to high priority tickets and incidents
  • troubleshoot issues pertaining to the infrastructure running customer applications
  • active participation to automation and streamlining projects

Must have: 

  • Extensive experience with web applications of various kinds. PHP, Node.js, and Python applications are especially important to our current business
  • Experience with IaaS solutions, such as AWS, Microsoft Azure
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills: demoing products, explaining value and fielding technical, process and business-related questions
  • Ability to do the job in exquisite written and spoken English
  • Deep understanding of complete, modern hosting stacks
  • Experience with CDNs
  • Knowledge of DNS
  • Understanding of SSL certificates and encryption
  • Ability to use Git

Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3
  • Relational database skills
  • Public speaking experience
  • Blogging or writing experience
  • Experience as a performing musician, competitive athlete, dancer, actor, scout, sailor, or magician
  • Ability to kick ass in Chess or Go
  • A passion for photography, painting, or home brewing beer

About Platform.sh

We’re a venture capital funded, award-winning team of hard-core hackers who want to revolutionize the way that developers and agencies build and deploy web applications. We’re mostly distributed, but we meet up daily in cyberspace, and occasionally in Paris, France.  We value enthusiasm, team spirit, and a constant desire to expand personal knowledge and contribute to the community. We provide a multi-cultural, casual and balanced work environment. We recently helped launch Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition and the Sensio Cloud on Platform.sh technology.

Benefits

Work from home, wherever you are
Safe and friendly working environment
Stock options for everyone
Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

Senior Support Engineer - APAC Region

Posted Mar 27

CircleCI
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA

YOUR IMPACT
As a Senior Support Engineer at CircleCI you will have an impact every day by working directly with our customers to help them get the best from the CircleCI platform. You’ll be working directly with developers (both customers and CircleCI engineers) to help shape and improve the the product and customer experience.

ABOUT THE ROLE
This is a full-time, remote position. You’re someone who thrives working remotely without much oversight. You’ll be part of the Support Team which is currently ten people. We’re a fully remote team with employees around world. You’ll spend most of your days sending timely, human replies to questions via support tickets, but you’ll also write documentation, troubleshoot bugs, and collaborate with our teams to be as helpful as possible to our customers.

As a Senior Support Engineer you’ll focus on technical ‘deep-dives’ to get to the bottom of problems and create solutions. We’d rather you spent a day solving a tricky problem for an important customer than running through 30 easy tickets. You’ll be writing scripts, suggesting configuration enhancements and automating processes for customers and our internal tooling. Writing bug reports and escalations for the product and engineering teams is an important part of the role. You’ll be given plenty of autonomy to do what’s right and in the best interests of our customers.

About CircleCI
CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.
We run 7M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI.  We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

Requirements:

  • To apply for this role you should be located in an APAC equivalent timezone - UTC +13 to UTC +8 so you do not need to work far outside of normal business hours where you live.
  • This job is Monday-Friday, full-time office hours in your timezone (hours are flexible but we prefer it if you can keep a regular pattern). You need to be available for full time work
  • You have strong Linux / Unix based operating system knowledge with at least two years professional experience using command line tools on a daily basis. Bash and shell scripting skills are required.
  • You have some professional experience developing web and / or mobile applications.
  • You’ve written code in more than one language such as Ruby, Python, PHP, JavaScript, or Java
  • You’re familiar with the ecosystems around the web application stacks for some of these languages (their frameworks, dependency management tools and deployment options).
  • You’re familiar with relational and non-relational databases and their configuration options.
  • You’re experienced with Git and GitHub / Bitbucket.
  • You’ve worked with Docker and container based technologies.
  • You’re comfortable searching and reading log files to locate the source of problems.
  • Have some knowledge of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.
  • Have some knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery methodologies.
  • You are fluent in spoken and written English.
  • Excellent communication skills are a core requirement. Your writing is clear and simple.
  • You’re confident with humility and empathy.
  • You’re patient and resilient, with an excellent sense of humor.
  • You have determination and take initiative and ownership to see things through to completion. If it needs doing, you do it.
  • You are self-sufficient and love the challenge of solving problems and learning new things (especially about computing and programming).

Apply for this position

Customer Support Engineer @ LUMA Institute

2018-03-22 01:08

Description

Are you someone who wants to make things better?

LUMA Institute empowers people to innovate everywhere by transforming the way they work. Customer support engineers contribute to shaping our growing range of digital offerings by eliminating technical obstacles and making customer support a delightful extension of our brand and product experience. This is an ideal role for a talented engineer who is passionate about supporting people who are using LUMA Workplace every day to transform their work.

You will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, partnering at times with sales and customer IT departments to provide access to thousands of users integrating LUMA Workplace into their projects. At other times, you will be the single point person for diagnosing and resolving technical issues.

What will I do?
  • Make customer support delightful. You will partner directly with customers to troubleshoot and solve technical problems on a daily basis. You take an “at your service” approach to both internal and external customer requests.
  • Drive and support SSO implementations. You will work to successfully integrate LUMA Workplace with SAML 2.0 Identity Federation services with customers. You will facilitate all steps of SSO integration and respond to client calls for real-time assistance with user access.
  • Support the LUMA sales team. You will regularly work alongside the Sales, Marketing, and Account Management teams. You will engage in pre-sales activities to understand client technical environments, constraints and policies. Your goal is to ensure clients are prepared to get maximum value from LUMA’s digital offerings.
  • Coordinate incident management. You will establish, maintain and evolve how we handle support requests. You will create and maintain documentation for support processes, resources and services.
  • Create self-service options. You will recognize patterns and publish support articles based on common issues. You will reduce the number of direct inquiries by establishing options for customers to solve problems instantly.
  • Report support metrics. You will define and configure data for monitoring support performance against critical metrics (resolution rate, time to respond, customer satisfaction, ticket volume, etc.). You will empower the product team with metrics to understand the health of our product offerings.
  • Influence product direction. You will serve as a vital connection between our customers and our product team. You will have the opportunity to influence the direction of LUMA Workplace informed by your regular communication with our customers.
  • Create chemistry. You will help shape an environment where all members of the team can be healthy, happy, and productive. You will support the work efforts and professional development of other engineers on the team. You will take a human-centered design approach to think through problems.
What skills and experience do I need?
  • Proven background. At least 2 years experience supporting SaaS products at scale.
  • Work well under pressure. Experience with incident management and the ability to triage multiple issues simultaneously. You thrive when deadlines are pushing your limits.
  • Implementation knowledge and experience. Your identity is tied to your knowledge of Federation SSO using SAML 2.0, WS-Federation, and Identity Management systems.
  • Solid basic knowledge of programming practices. You don’t have to be proficient in our stack but you should know how to script (Bash, Perl, or Python) and have an active interest in learning our technologies (Rails, JavaScript, Ember, SCSS, NodeJS, PostgreSQL, and Redis).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and documentation skills. You can explain complex topics in easily understood, concise language. You can write about technical issues for a non-technical audience or experienced developers.
What additional skills might make me stand out?
  • Specific experience with SaaS products and not just websites
  • Ability to edit HTML, CSS or JavaScript directly (without help from engineering)
  • Experience teaching and/or facilitating workshops
  • Fluency in another language
Benefits

We take care of our people and reward them with some great perks.

  • A remote work policy, so you can borrow the “cone of silence” for heads down work, or be a productive team member outside of Pittsburgh. We have workspaces through Industrious with 24 U.S. locations and counting.
  • Rest easy as your care is covered with Health, Dental, Long and Short Term Disability, Life and AD&D, and Vision Insurances
  • Paid maternity & paternity leave provides time to attend to your most precious development project
  • A rested team is a productive team. Recharge periodically with 4 weeks of vacation
  • Make matched contributions through our 401K Retirement Plan
  • Develop additional skills and learning with supported professional development
  • No worries if you choose not to drive to work with a transportation allowance
  • We provide everyone MacBook Pro laptops and whatever equipment that supports your most productive work
Location

Stay where you are, or join us in Pittsburgh. The choice is yours.

In case you didn’t know, Pittsburgh is proud to rank among the top place to live, work, and visit in the United States. Our city is consistently recognized with accolades from major travel and financial organizations as one of the most livable cities and as having one of the most vibrant economies.

About LUMA Institute

LUMA Institute is the only company in the world dedicated fully – and solely – to empowering individuals, teams and organization to innovate by transforming the way they work. Leading organizations around the globe rely on the LUMA System of Innovation – a unique and scalable system of Human-Centered Design.

We offer [custom innovation programs](custom innovation programs) for large organizations, acclaimed public workshops in cities worldwide, and a unique digital platform, LUMA Workplace, used by innovators in more than 70 countries on six continents. We work with organizations of all types, sizes and sectors — business, government, non-profit and education, with impact and outcome demonstrated in client success stories.

Technical Support Engineer @ WP Site Care

Description

At WP Site Care, nothing makes us happier than watching entrepreneurs and small businesses grow their reach online. We work with companies from brand new startups to established high traffic publishers in a wide variety of roles and an array of technical environments.

Our small distributed team of 8 (yay remote work) serves hundreds of customers each month; proactively managing WordPress technology and consulting our customers to help them make smart decisions for their business.

As a technical support engineer you’ll be working directly with customers via our help desk to solve technical issues they encounter using WordPress, as well as implementing new solutions to help them grow their business and improve their online presence.

If you’re an analytical thinker with a knack for non-linear logic and you also love working with other people, you’ll be a fantastic fit on our team.

Our Team

Our team is spread across the Western United States and Canada. Customer support is the heartbeat of WP Site Care. Our support team helps our customers, and also helps the rest of our team know what our customers need.

Feedback and learning from our customer support team has a massive influence in initiatives of the company. You’ll be playing an integral role in shaping the decisions we make as a business by communicating how we can improve our offering to meet the needs of our customers.

Because we’re a distributed team, fantastic written communication skills are essential. Being able to clearly articulate a problem, explain steps taken to reproduce the issue, and proposing solutions is an essential piece of every day work. It’s also important to know how to ask for help from a teammate, and being clear about exactly what’s needed.

We want an honest team member who values hard work and accountability, and who can communicate openly when they need assistance with a complex issue.

Responsibilities
  • Proactive site management of a portfolio of customers in our CRM tool, Hubspot
  • Answering tickets via our help desk, Help Scout
  • Troubleshooting and debugging potentially complex WordPress issues in behalf of customers – even if you can’t always close every ticket, we love seeing technicians who can be resourceful and use all of the tools available to them to resolve issues.
  • Helping teammates via Slack to resolve their sticky issues
  • Experience working in a support role and feeling satisfaction when tickets are closed and customer issues are resolved
  • Communicating opportunities for ways we can improve our services
  • Creating and updating internal documentation
  • Working directly with web hosts to troubleshoot and debug complex issues on behalf of customers
Requirements
  • Patience and a sense of humor – Technical support can be demanding, so we try and keep it light.
  • 2+ years of customer-facing technical support in a team environment
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize work, and stay motivated on projects without managerial oversight
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting WordPress technical issues
  • Experience using version control. We use Github as a git repository for everything we work on
  • Familiarity with the WordPress hosting landscape
  • Familiarity with a dev/staging/production approach to making code changes to a website
  • Proficiency in the following: SSH, SFTP, DNS, HTML, CSS, SCSS, Sass, PHP, WordPress coding standards, migrating WordPress, and theme/plugin relationships within WordPress.
  • Nice to have: Proficiency with WP-CLI, JavaScript, and MySQL/MariaDB.
Meeting Up

We’re a completely distributed company and we believe it’s important to get together in person from time to time to build relationships and learn together. We’ll occasionally meet at conferences and WordCamps, or in smaller groups to get work done together. We also have one company retreat annually where everyone is invited and the entire team gets together. It’s always a great time. If you love to travel you’ll have plenty of opportunity when you work at WP Site Care.

Reimbursement & Benefits

We offer competitive salary based on experience of applicants. We also offer all of the following:

We are looking for a rockstar Client Care Specialist to join our team and provide superior customer service that exceeds our client's expectations.

You get to work from home with an amazing team of Client Care Specialists that care deeply about building and strengthening our client relationships. You will educate clients on our products and respond to tough (and not-so-tough) inquiries through email using Desk.com and on live chat using Intercom.io. Knows their stuff. This can't be your first rodeo. You have at least 2 years of experience in a web-based, service oriented company providing customer support where email and live chat were your primary responsibilities.

Can read between the lines. Sometimes a client's question isn't always obvious, and I'm sure you know, a lot can get lost in 'email' translation. A client may be asking for one thing, and really need something else. You have an uncanny ability to read into what they are looking for, ask the right questions, and exceed their expectations by responding to their real question.

Has great sleuthing skills. You are able to do your own detective work and find clues with the tools you have access to. You never pass on a case without first trying to piece the puzzle together.

Is an exceptional communicator. You know how to get your message across clearly and concisely to different audiences, through the written word. You are a skilled writer and have outstanding proofreading skills. Yup, you're a natural here.

Leaves their ego at the door. You have integrity, talent, are outgoing, have a palpable excitement about the future, and don't show it off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, and excessive 'constructive criticism' are out.

Wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization. PN is a pretty incredible place and is committed to allowing you to do the work you love and love the work you do.

Ethfinex -Remote
Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Who we are

We’ve assembled a small, agile team, working in remote locations, at the beginning of a fast-moving, disruptive industry.

We are passionate about what we do. We’re optimistic about the future, and we are hard at work shaping it.

Ethfinex is an information & exchange platform for ERC20 tokens and Ethereum-based projects. Our mission is to create the home of digital token trading & discussion - the world’s most liquid digital asset exchange platform, owned & run by the people using it.

Our vision is to create a free and accessible global digital economy by disrupting the current financial services industry. Come join us, and lay the foundation for a decentralised future.

Who we are looking for

We are looking for world-class Remote Customer Service Agents to join our growing team.

When we say “world-class,” we mean it. We don’t want to be second best. Our goal is to lead not only the industry, but to deliver a level of support which is recognized outside it too.

Responsibilities

  • Answer a variety of customer queries via different channels, including e-mail, live chat and social media.
  • Educate our growing customer base in the use of our tools and the technology which backs it up.
  • Investigate technical issues which have resulted in delayed deposits, withdrawals, etc.
  • Become an expert in every aspect of our products, such as cryptocurrencies, tokens and trading.
  • Be a true advocate for our customers.
  • Create tutorial videos and knowledge base articles in order to assist customers in resolving issues independently.
  • Collate and filter feedback from customers and make suggestions as to how we can improve our service and increase efficiency (this is an important one, you will have a voice in how we operate, and you will be given the credit you deserve for your success).

Your Experience

Essential

  • You will be remotely located, so laser focused drive and determination are a must.
  • 1+ years in a Customer Service role responding to large volumes of emails and chats.
  • Excellent written and verbal skills (in English).
  • Proficient in Mac OS or Linux.
  • Strong communication skills, your fellow team members will also be remote.
  • Experience of ticketing and/or live chat software (OS Tickets, Zen Desk, Happy Fox etc.)
  • Genuine interest in and understanding of cryptocurrencies, tokens and block chain technology.
  • Able to explain complex concepts in easy to understand language

Desirable

  • Experience of working remotely/homeworking.
  • Experience in the cryptocurrency/block chain space.
  • Additional languages.
  • Experience creating tutorial videos and knowledgebase content.

Other Requirements

  • A quiet space to enable you to work remotely.
  • Ability to travel abroad for training if required.
  • A stable internet connection of 8 Mbps minimum.
  • A Linux or Mac OS computer capable of running multiple applications simultaneously.
  • Ability to work flexible hours, remember you will be at home so it’s not all bad.

Keep in mind

Please keep in mind that whomever is successful in securing this role will not be directly employed but will be a contractor. We will pay you a generous salary and you will have the flexibility to work from wherever you want in the world!

We do however not pay your taxes, insurance etc. so you will be responsible for taking care of that.

Please also keep in mind that as you will be working remotely we will ask you to install various software packages on your computer including one which monitors productivity when working.

How to apply

In order to apply please include your most up to date CV/Resume as well as telling us a little bit about yourself, your past employment and your thoughts on the industry.

Please don’t send us a template cover letter, we want to get to know you and find out how you would fit into our team. Show us the real you.

The ability to communicate via email is essential for this role so unfortunately, we will be unable to consider any applications which do not include a cover letter.

Please also let us know your availability and your salary expectations in USD.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

items.content:
Onboarding and support specialist for an events app (contractor)

The big picture - we sell, onboard and account manage the products and services of tech companies that are looking to gain traction abroad without the risk and cost of setting up there. This specific role is to onboard and support customers on an events app.

Job spec

This is a great opportunity for someone to get in early as a founding member whilst making some decent coin. This will initially not require much of your time however you will need to have flexibility during the day (perfect as a side project for someone). This role is as much about managing relationships and problem solving as it is about tech.

When one of our sales team makes a sale for an event or a series of events, it's assigned to a support specialist (you). You'll make initial contact with the client for an 'onboarding call' during which you'll confirm with them what they want and what that means in terms of configuring the app for their purpose. This is usually a back and forth process and, on average, takes hours not days.

Once the onboarding process is complete and the event is ready, we switch to support mode. This consists of:
- testing the app before the event to make sure it works
- calling the client just before the event to see if they need any assistance
- being available to them during the event in case something goes wrong - sometimes we can troubleshoot level one issues and sometimes we have to escalate them to our tech team
- contacting the client post event to see how things went

On offer

10% of revenue and shares (not a salaried position)
Can work remotely
You won't have to do anything until we've made a sale then it will be handed over to you
Note - this is an opportunity to get involved in a startup that's currently in the garage stage

Ideal for
A student/recent graduate looking for startup experience and a side hustle
A freelancer looking to add another project to their calendar

If you have any questions please feel free to get in contact. We look forward to hearing from you.

Support Agent

Posted Jan 26

Decisiv, Inc.
Headquarters: Glen Allen, VA
https://www.decisiv.com/support-agent-remote

Job Summary

Decisiv is looking for talented support professionals to work remotely on a contract basis as we simultaneously grow our customer base outside of North America and update/expand our platform and its underlying technology stack.
We need great people to support Decisiv’s cloud-based Service Relationship Management (SRM) platform outside of North America and to help our Support team evolve from a co-located, startup-style, North-America-only team to a highly-professional, remote-first, worldwide Support organization.

What You’ll Be Doing

Decisiv Support is a small, fast-growing, and remote-first team, so you'll acquire experience on a variety of technologies and support situations while working with us. That said, here are some things you're likely to do as a Support Agent:

  • Support customers’ day-to-day support requests via email, telephone, live chat, or in-app
  • Thoroughly documenting potential defects for troubleshooting by Support Engineers and QA
  • Monitor platform performance and triage customer-reported problems
  • Work effectively and efficiently under limited supervision, earning autonomy to use initiative and independent judgment
  • Evaluate current and new Decisiv functionality and create written and visual content for knowledge base articles & videos, tool tips, and template responses to customer questions and problems
  • Learn! Our Support team and our platform are evolving, so there will be many opportunities to learn and grow.

Necessary Qualifications

  • 1+ year(s) of academic or technical experience with:
  • Desktop and mobile operating systems
  • All major browsers and versions
  • Common web protocols and technologies such as HTTP, FTP, email deliverability; and network connectivity
  • Reading and interpreting log files, regardless of source application
  • 1+ years of support experience in a technology environment comparable to Decisiv
  • Ability to clearly articulate complex thoughts in any situation, from having a technical discussion with an engineer to working with a non-technical user
  • Ability to manage time and prioritize efficiently
  • Ability to create ‘How To’ videos, knowledge base articles, application walk-throughs, or other similar content
  • Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience (a degree is not required!)
  • Proficient spoken and written communication skills in both American English and at least one of the following: Spanish, French, Swedish, or Japanese.

    • Other Requirements

    • Reliable access to an appropriate work location where you can take telephone & video calls and record high-quality video & audio without interruption, distraction, or background noise
    • A strong, stable broadband internet connection that can handle simultaneous Voice Over Internet Protocol (VOIP) calls, streaming video, and comparable high-bandwidth applications (typically, 8 Mbps upload / 1.5 Mbps download at a minimum)
    • Availability to work 40 hours per week and be “on-call” for select weekends (typically, one weekend every other month) within Decisiv Support's hours of operations
    • Located full-time in one of the following locations or time zones:
    • Gothenburg, Sweden
    • Ageo, Japan
    • Central Time
    • Mountain Time
    • Pacific Time
    • Western European Time
    • Central European Time

About Wildbit

At Wildbit, we believe developers shouldn’t spend time in the weeds of process, infrastructure, and communication. Our products remove that pain, allowing teams to design, code, and ship brilliant software. Our apps include Postmark, Beanstalk, and Conveyor. (This position is for Postmark.)

Beyond our work, Wildbit exists for our team, and our products and customers allow us to do the best work of our lives, together. We’ve been in business for 17 years, and over 100,000 companies around the world trust our products to help them create and ship incredible software. We currently have a team of 26 with 15 of those team members working remotely from all over the world. We don’t dabble in remote-work or just barely tolerate it, we run the company as if everyone was remote, and we go out of our way to ensure that remote team members feel just as much a part of the family as the folks in Philadelphia.

To learn more about the importance of a healthy culture at Wildbit, you can browse our blog posts about culture, and you’ll get a clearer picture of how we’re different from your average team.

About this Position

We’re looking for someone who understands that customer success is a focus on customers, not on ourselves. At Wildbit, our focus is entirely on enabling teams to build and launch their own products and services. Our success team handles our customer's needs proactively (success) and reactively (support) across our three products (Beanstalk, Conveyor, and Postmark).

We currently have solid time zone coverage in the Americas, but we’d like to expand the team to add someone from the EU to help provide better time zone coverage for our customers whose day starts a little earlier. And don’t worry, with 3 (current) other team members in Europe, you won’t be the only one working slightly different hours from the rest of the team.

You’ll help new customers get up to speed quickly, educate developers on industry best practices, and help our team identify where we can better meet the needs of our customers. This means creating content and user guides, talking to customers over various channels (email, support, live chat, phone, etc), analyzing behaviors, and keeping our developers and designers up to speed at all times. Most of all, this job is about empowering developers to do their best work. And to have fun doing it!

Requirements:

  • a solid understanding of transactional email and email technologies (SPF, DKIM, DMARC)
  • experience in measuring and tracking your own results
  • for this position, we’re looking someone in or near Europe to work 8am–4pm UTC/GMT
  • solid writing skills for answering customer support requests as well as writing help docs and user guides
  • empathy for novice developers
  • a desire to teach

Nice to haves:

  • previous experience in customer success/product management
  • previous experience in customer support
  • previous experience supporting or building a Saas product

Benefits:

  • Full health benefits
  • Company-paid team retreats
  • Computer of your choice, renewed every 2 years
  • Quarterly profit sharing
  • Attend conferences
  • 40 hour work week with flexible hours and 25 paid days off per year (We’re currently experimenting with 4-day/32 hour work weeks and 20 paid days off per year) 

Wildbit is an equal opportunity employer and proud of it.

We’re committed to building a diverse team, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. At our core we believe deeply in diversity, inclusiveness, and acceptance as all being key parts of a healthy team.

Support Operations Manager

Zapier

Hi there! We're looking for someone to help cultivate our growing Support team at Zapier. The Support Operations Manager helps shepherd all the initiatives in Support that have Leads (e.g., Documentation, Training), helping to prioritize their work for the best results and highest impact. They're responsible for managing the Leads of those initiatives, setting an example in helping users directly, and working with Support Managers to ensure those initiatives have proper bandwidth from the right people. If you love helping users and developing others to get results that make those users' lives even easier, then read on!

Even though our job description may seem like we are looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the individual who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you have a heart for users and love helping them directly. You also enjoy leveling up individuals so they can drive results for their teams.

About You

You put your teammates' and customers' needs first. You enjoy helping support teams and enabling them to do great work. You put in the time to understand the strengths and weaknesses of those who report to you, providing ways to magnify their strengths and provide feedback to improve their weaknesses.

You have experience driving results.You've successfully led projects involving the work of a team of people. You do this by holding that team accountable to goals and stay aligned with company-wide priorities, while enabling your team to work autonomously.

You have excellent communication skills. You make sure those who report to you understand how they are doing and what is important at any point in time. You're always available with a suggestion on how to phrase a response to a tricky customer ticket.

You have experience hiring and managing a team. This isn't your first rodeo. You have hired, trained and managed folks before.

You love helping users directly. Everyone at Zapier does Support, and as a leader in the Support team it's part of your daily routine. You make customers feel empowered after interacting with support and not feel stupid because of a small mistake. You love the opportunity to solve new problems every day and won't give up when you don't know the answer right away.

You wear many hats. You are constantly leveling up your people management skills. You have the relevant Support skills to build rapport with those you manage. On a weekly basis you can expect to be holding one-on-ones with Support Leads, thinking through tricky tickets and giving feedback, prioritizing Support project work, and helping influence the direction of Support for all of Zapier.

You take pride in empowering teammates. As a manager you know that by helping to get the best out of many people, you can achieve results far greater than would be possible alone. That challenge motivates and excites you.

Things You Might Do

Zapier is a small, fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:

  • Help meet and exceed our Support goals
  • Build rapport with Support Leads and work hard to help them level up their skills
  • Collaborate with Support leads and managers to prioritize project work and set direction for Support as a whole
  • Help customers via email or chat to ensure they have the best experience possible, troubleshooting their problems and answering their questions
  • Hold weekly one on ones with Support Leads
  • Experiment: this is a startup so everything can change
